Package com.examapp.controllers

Class StatusController

java.lang.Object
com.examapp.controllers.StatusController
@CrossOrigin @RestController @RequestMapping("status") public class StatusController extends Object
  • Handles operations related to student verification and suspicious image management.
  • APIs available:
    1. check if the input image matches the stored user image (checkFaces)
    2. retrieve a list of suspicious images for a specific user and class (getSuspiciousImageList)
    3. retrieve a list of students along with their suspicious status (getSuspiciousList)
  • All endpoint require token obtained from logging in
  • Teacher specific:
    • getSuspiciousImageList:
    • getSuspiciousList

  • Method Details

    • getSuspiciousImageList

      @GetMapping("/suspiciousImage") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Map>> getSuspiciousImageList(@RequestParam String classname, @RequestParam String username)
      GET - Retrieves a list of suspicious images for a specified class and user. This method maps to the "/status/suspiciousImage" endpoint. It fetches a list of suspicious image stored in Redis based on the provided class name and username.

      Ensure to include a Bearer token in the request header for authentication.

      Note: This operation can only be performed by a teacher.

      Parameters:
      classname - The name of the class for which to retrieve suspicious images (required).
      username - The username of the user for whom suspicious images are being retrieved (required).
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of maps, where each map represents a suspicious image with relevant details.

      Example response:

       [
     {
         "imageFile": suspicious image (in byte[]),
         "timestamp": timestamp which the image is taken (in epoch milli)
     },
     {
         "imageFile": suspicious image (in byte[]),
         "timestamp": timestamp which the image is taken (in epoch milli)
     }
 ]

    • getSuspiciousList

      @GetMapping("/suspicious/list") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Map>> getSuspiciousList(@RequestParam String classname)
      GET - Retrieves a list of student with suspicious marked. This method maps to the "/status/suspicious/list" endpoint. Retrieves a list of students from a specified class along with their suspicious status.

      Ensure to include a Bearer token in the request header for authentication.

      Note: This operation can only be performed by a teacher.

      Parameters:
      classname - the name of the class for which to retrieve the suspicious student list
      Returns:
      a list of maps, where each map contains the username of a student and a boolean indicating whether the student has suspicious images

      Example response:

       [
     {
         "username": "student name 1",
         "suspicious": true
     },
     {
         "username": "student name 2",
         "suspicious": false
     }
 ]
